title: BOC User can resend the Daily Transaction Bulletin Notification
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is a BOC user
custom_steps: WHEN clicking the Resend Email Notification button
custom_expected: THEN a past bulletin will resend

title: BOC User can Edit the Daily Transaction Bulletin
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is a BOC user
custom_steps: WHEN clicking edit on a Daily Transaction Bulletin
custom_expected:
THEN the tx will reload for form in edit mode
AND the save button will be be clicked on the bottom of the form

title: BOC User can create the Daily Transaction Bulletin
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is a BOC user
custom_steps:
WHEN the transaction bulletin is in View or Edit mode
AND clicking the SEND Bulletin button
custom_expected:
THEN it will save any changes made, take the current Pending Bulletin and build the Transaction Bulletin - assigning it an ID and adding it to the "Date" dropdown at the top of the page as "{Current Date} - {Transaction ID#}"
AND any transactions that are checked as "Hold" will NOT be added to the new bulletin
AND will instead roll to the next Pending bulletin
AND the "Hold" checkbox will remain checked
AND a new Pending bulletin will be created and be available in the "Date" dropdown

title: BOC User can print the Daily Transaction Bulletin from the widget
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is logged in as BOC
AND is viewing the Daily Transaction Bulletin
custom_steps: WHEN the user clicks Print
custom_expected: THEN a PDF is generated with the data in this tab

title: Bulletin Email should contain PDF attachment if there are Entries
custom_preconds: GIVEN there are entries on the Daily Transaction Bulletin
custom_steps:
WHEN user Sends or Resends bulletin
AND user is on email list
custom_expected: THEN user will receive an email with a PDF attachment

title: User can edit a row in the Taxi Squad widget
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the taxi squad widget
custom_steps: WHEN clicking the pencil icon that is displayed on each row
custom_expected:
THEN the row will be placed into edit mode
AND pencil icon becomes an X
AND User can place more than one row into edit mode at a time

title: BOC Approver can approve the transactions from the clipboard
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Approvals widget
custom_steps:
WHEN selecting a Major League tx
AND clicking Approve
custom_expected:
THEN the system will update all of the selected tx to have a status of "Approved"
AND make all "On Approved" updates for all of the selected tx's

title: BOC Approver can reject the transactions from the clipboard
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Approvals widget
custom_steps:
WHEN selecting a Major League tx
AND clicking Reject
custom_expected:
THEN the system will update all of the selected tx to have a status of "Rejected"
AND make all "On Reject" updates for all of the selected tx's

title: BOC user can reset the filters on the clipboard
custom_steps:
WHEN the user applies some filters to the clipboard other than the default filters
AND changes the Attachments filter
AND clicks Apply
AND clicks Reset
custom_expected: THEN all the selected filters, including Attachments, reset to default

title: User can Save a Roster
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is viewing the Special Rosters utility (from Rosters side bar menu)
AND the "Save" Button is visible
AND the button should be a split button that allows the user to choose whether to save "Roster(s) & Comments" or "Comments Only"
custom_steps: WHEN When the user clicks Save
custom_expected:
THEN if "Roster(s) & Comments" is selected, the system will capture a snapshot of the roster information for the selected Org, Level and Club as applicable, and write the information to the appropriate table based on the "Save Roster As" selection.
AND a successful blue notification will display. "{Roster type} Roster has been saved successfully" 
BUT if "Comments Only" then only the comments will be saved

title: As a user I want to be able to run the Post Season Eligibility Roster Report
custom_preconds:
Report Layout: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Post+Season+Eligibility+Roster+Report+Layout

Report Details: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Post+Season+Eligibility+Roster+Report+Details

Report Logic: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=116198866

Report Prompts: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Post+Season+Eligibility+Roster+Report+Prompts

Acceptance Criteria: 
* "Post Season Eligibility Roster" is a report in the Report listing widget. Selecting this report from the widget will launch the prompts according to the requirements. 
* The category of this report should be "Rosters". 
* Entering the desired prompts and running the report will work and match the requirements. 
* The report will have an LDAP associated with it. Please provide the LDAP when the story is delivered and a user id to test the report and security with.

title: As a user I want to be able to run the Division Series Roster Report
custom_preconds:
Report Layout: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Division+Series+Roster+Report+Layout

Report Details: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Division+Series+Roster+Report+Details

Report Prompts: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Division+Series+Roster+Report+Prompts

*The accompanying sourcing story must be delivered prior to starting this story #149129889*

Acceptance Criteria: 
* "Division Series Roster" is a report in the Report listing widget. Selecting this report from the widget will launch the prompts according to the requirements. 
* The category of this report should be "Rosters". 
* Entering the desired prompts and running the report will work and match the requirements. 
* The report will have an LDAP associated with it. Please provide the LDAP when the story is delivered and a user id to test the report and security with.

title: BOC user can edit an existing manually added entry in a player's player history
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has a new manual entry that has been saved to the player history
AND a pencil icon appears in view mode for ONLY the rows that have been manually added
custom_steps: WHEN Clicking on the pencil icon places the entire row in edit mode, and enables a save button.
custom_expected:
THEN user has the ability to edit all values of the manual entry
AND Save must be clicked to maintain any changes to the row

title: User can save a new passed over player profile
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is in edit mode on a domestic amateur player profile
AND Save button is visible
custom_steps: WHEN clicking "Save"
custom_expected:
THEN the system will save the new player
AND a blue successful save notification will display. 
AND the "Draft Year" field will be populated with the previous year's draft year. 
AND the "Origin" field will not be populated. 
AND the player's draft history will remain blank. 
AND the player's Rule 4 Status is set to Passed Over.

title: As a user I want to be able to print the Service tab of a professional player profile
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=printing

Acceptance Criteria: 
* If a user has permission to see a player profile, then they see a Print button on the profile.
* Clicking "Print" will generate a pdf of the player's Service tab. 
* The pdf will ONLY display what the logged in user has permission to see on the Service tab within the app. 
* The width of the info should be limited to one page, with text wrapping as necessary. 
* The top of the pdf should contain the Player's Roster Name, Middle Initial, Last Name, baseball position, Club/Org, MLS, MJ and MN roster status and Player ID.

title: As a user I want to be able to print the CSP tab of a professional player profile
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=printing

Acceptance Criteria: 
* If a user has permission to see a player profile, then they see a Print button on the profile.
* Clicking "Print" will generate a pdf of the player's CSP tab. 
* The pdf will ONLY display what the logged in user has permission to see on the CSP tab within the app.
* If the user doesn't have CSP/CEP permissions, they will not see the option in the print modal.
* If the player doesn't have a CSP/CEP, the option will not appear in the print modal.
* The width of the info should be limited to one page, with text wrapping as necessary. 
* The top of the pdf should contain the Player's Roster Name, Middle Initial, Last Name, baseball position, Club/Org, MLS, MJ and MN roster status and Player ID.

custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=printing

Acceptance Criteria: 
* If a user has permission to see a player profile, then they see a Print button on the profile.
* Clicking "Print" will generate a pdf of the player's CEP tab. 
* The pdf will ONLY display what the logged in user has permission to see on the CEP tab within the app.
* If the user doesn't have CSP/CEP permissions, they will not see the option in the print modal.
* If the player doesn't have a CSP/CEP, the option will not appear in the print modal.
* The width of the info should be limited to one page, with text wrapping as necessary. 
* The top of the pdf should contain the Player's Roster Name, Middle Initial, Last Name, baseball position, Club/Org, MLS, MJ and MN roster status and Player ID.

* Clicking "Print" will generate a pdf of the player's Draft & Scouting tab. 
* The pdf will ONLY display what the logged in user has permission to see on the Draft & Scouting tab within the app. 
* The width of the info should be limited to one page, with text wrapping as necessary. 
* The top of the pdf should contain the Player's Roster Name, Middle Initial, Last Name, baseball position, Club/Org, MLS, MJ and MN roster status and Player ID.

* The top of the pdf should contain the Player's Roster Name, Middle Initial, Last Name, baseball position, Club/Org, MLS, MJ and MN roster status and Player ID.

title: A Club user can edit an existing Passed Over player profile so club can sign him
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is a Club user
AND viewing a Passed Over player profile
custom_steps: WHEN clicking the "Edit Signing Info" button
custom_expected:
THEN On the backend, if a record did not yet exist for this Club for the last year that the player had his profile entered in the draft, one is created for him. 
AND the user will have the ability to edit all of the non-matching fields for the player (Not Last, DOB or School)
AND clicking "Save" will save the changes to the profile and store the new Club record for the player where relevant. 
AND no change is made to any eligibility or draft history information.

title: A Club user can edit a Drafted player profile so the club can sign him
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is a Club User
AND is able to open and view any Drafted player profile in the system

ex:  player  https://ebisqa.mlb.com/ebisui/#/domestic-amateur/domestic-amateur-info?domAmaEntryId=20379&playerId=147509
custom_steps: WHEN a Club user is viewing a Drafted player profile
custom_expected:
THEN they should see an "Edit Signing Info" button ONLY if they were the most recent drafting Org. 
AND clicking the "Edit Signing Info" button will reload the profile in edit mode. 
AND the user will have the ability to edit all of the non-matching fields for the player (Not First, Last, DOB or School). 
AND clicking "Save" will save the changes to the profile. No change is made to any eligibility information.

title: A BOC user can edit a Passed Over player profile on behalf of a Club so that they can sign him
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is a BOC user
AN can open and view any Passed Over player profile in the system
custom_steps:
WHEN a BOC user is viewing a Passed Over player profile, they should see an "Edit Signing Info" button, and no Edit button
AND clicking the "Edit Signing Info" button. Edit Singing info is only available for (most recent amateur profile for that player)
custom_expected:
THEN it will prompt the BOC user to select which Org they are editing the record on behalf of
AND Once they have selected the Org, the system should reload the profile in edit mode.
AND If the player was an MLSB or Redraft player, then load that record in edit mode. 
AND If the Org selected already had a profile entered for the most recent draft the player participated in, then load that record in edit mode
BUT otherwise load the BOC Copy if it exists. 
AND load the first profile entered for the player for the most recent draft the player participated in.  
AND on the backend, if a record did not yet exist for this Club for the last year that the player had his profile entered in the draft, one is created for him. 
AND the user will have the ability to edit all of the fields for the player. 
AND clicking "Save" will save the changes to the profile and store the new Club record for the player where relevant.

title: User wants to see "Edit Signing Info" button if player is Passed Over
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user logged in is the BOC or a Club
custom_steps: WHEN user is viewing a Passed over player that has participated in the most recent draft
custom_expected: THEN user will see an "Edit Signing Info" button

title: User wants to see "Edit Signing Info" button if player is Drafted
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user logged in is the BOC or a Club
custom_steps: WHEN user is viewing a Drafted player that has participated in the most recent draft
custom_expected: THEN user will see an "Edit Signing Info" button

title: BOC user can edit Int'l Amateur player profiles
custom_preconds: GIVEN a BOC user is logged in
custom_steps: WHEN BOC user views an International Amateur Profile
custom_expected:
THEN International Amateur Profile should have an Edit button and a Close button in View mode
AND BOC users should be able to edit all sections of the profile
AND clicking edit should reload the profile in edit mode
AND Contact Information section should be displayed as separate sections for Phone Numbers, Emails, and Addresses
AND By default, at least one address fieldset, one phone number fieldset, and one email fieldset should display
AND users should be able to add additional address, phone, and email fieldsets by clicking the Add button found in each section
AND Users should be able to remove additional fieldsets by clicking on the trashcan icon
AND trashcan icon should only display in edit mode
AND if only one fieldset in a section displays, then the trashcan icon should NOT display
AND users should have the ability to select the country associated with the address
AND country selected should drive what additional fields display, and whether they are Select2 or Text inputs
AND details for this should be the same as was previously used for agent and agency profiles
AND zip Code should only be displayed for the United States, Canada and US territories (Puerto Rico, Guam, US Virgin Islands)
AND Formatting checks should only be done if the country selected is the United States (In that case, the system will need to verify that 5 numbers have been entered for the Zip Code field)
AND while in edit mode, a Save button should be available

title: View an Int'l Grandfathered profile
custom_preconds: GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in
custom_steps:
WHEN user navigates to an International Grandfathered Profile 

ex:  https://ebistrn.mlb.com/ebisui/#/intl-amateur/info?playerId=768798

ex:https://ebistrn.mlb.com/ebisui/#/intl-amateur/info?playerId=399988
custom_expected:
THEN profile should match the layout of the wireframe and data discovery
AND only BOC users should see the Attached Files and Comments sections
AND contact information that was entered on a grandfathered profile in ebis 2 should appear on the grandfathered profile in ebis 2.5
AND layout of the contact information should match the wireframe
(Note that some fields that display on International Amateur profile do NOT display on International Grandfathered profile)

title: Save an Int'l Grandfathered profile
custom_preconds: GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in
custom_steps:
WHEN user navigates to an International Grandfathered Profile

ex:  https://ebistrn.mlb.com/ebisui/#/intl-amateur/info?playerId=768798

ex:  https://ebistrn.mlb.com/ebisui/#/intl-amateur/info?playerId=399988
custom_expected:
THEN Edit button should be present on International Grandfathered profile
AND BOC users should be able to edit all sections of the profile
AND club users should be able to edit the Contact Information and Scouting Info Sections ONLY
AND edit functionality should be the same as: https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/128354701
AND clicking Save should run a required fields rules check
AND once required fields check has passed, changes should be committed and profile should load in view mode
BUT clicking Cancel should ask the user if they are sure they wish to cancel
AND if user confirms the cancellation no changes should be committed and profile should load in view mode
BUT  if user does not confirm the cancellation the user should be returned to the profile in edit mode

title: User can view each player's years of minor league service on the minor league roster widget
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the minor league roster widget
custom_steps: when on the Minor League Roster widget
custom_expected: THEN Mn Service Yrs will be a visible column

title: User can export the MN League Roster widget
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is on the MN League Roster widget
AND Under the downward arrow icon, there is an option to export to excel and an option to export to pdf
custom_steps: WHEN Choosing export to excel
custom_expected: THEN it will generate an excel document with the currently selected MN Roster, including all of the visible columns

title: User can see a player's Rule 5 information in the MJ Roster widget
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the MJ Roster widget
custom_steps: WHEN on the Major League Roster widget
custom_expected:
THEN "DE/SEL" is a visible column
AND If player is currently DE or SEL then it appears in the column. 
BUT If player does not have a Rule 5 Status of DE or SEL for the current year then the column is blank.

title: User can export the MJ League Roster widget
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is under the downward arrow icon on the MJ League Roster widget
AND there is an option to export to excel and an option to export to pdf
custom_steps: WHEN Choosing export to excel
custom_expected: THEN it will generate an excel document with the currently selected MJ Roster, including all of the visible columns.

title: User can see employees at the bottom of the MJ Roster widget
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the MJ Roster Widget
custom_steps: WHEN at the bottom of the Roster widget
custom_expected:
THEN any employees listed will display AFTER all of the players except players on 60 Day IL (still sorted by Last, First). 
AND Rows that contain employees should only display the employee's Name and Roster Status - all other columns should be blank.

title: A user can save an advanced search
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is on an advanced search
AND "Save Search" appears and is enabled as soon as the first filter's criteria is added.
BUT "Save Search" is disabled if no criteria is entered.
custom_steps: WHEN clicking "Save Search"
custom_expected:
THEN it triggers a pop-up that allows the user to enter in the title of their search. 
AND no check is made to ensure that the title isn't already in use. 
AND clicking "Save" will store the search criteria under the entered title. 
AND a blue notification will appear to indicate that the search was saved. 
AND the saved searches dropdown is now populated with the option and the option is active.

title: A user can run a saved search
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has one or more searches saved
AND a dropdown with the placeholder text "Saved searches" appears to the right of the search for dropdown on the advanced search screen
custom_steps: WHEN selecting a saved search from the dropdown
custom_expected:
THEN it will set the "Search For" dropdown to the type associated with the saved search
AND populate the filters section with the saved filter criteria. 
AND The loaded filters will be editable. 
AND The search will not initiate until the user clicks "Search"
BUT If the user has no saved searches this dropdown is not visible.

title: User can run all Rule 5 reports from the reporting widget
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is logged in as BOC
AND is viewing the reporting widget
custom_steps:
THEN the BOC can run each of the following reports
Reserve List Submission

Rule 5 Order of Selection
History of Rule 5 Phase Selections
Press Release Selection List
Reserve List Cover Sheet
Players Selected in (Year) Draft
Potential Rule 5 Selectable
Status of Rule 5 Selections
Reserve List Summary
custom_expected: AND prompts and data appear as expected

WHEN user runs the following reports:
CSP CEP Detail by Year - Total Liability

CSP CEP Detail by Club - Adjusted Liability

CSP CEP Detail by Individual - Total Liability
CSP CEP Percentage Usage
CSP CEP Detail by Year - Adjusted Liability

AND all reports will show CSP AND CEP information

custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is logged in as BOC
custom_steps: WHEN user runs the Press Release Selection List Report
custom_expected: THEN they will see each player listed with a different TO and FROM club

custom_steps:

Opening Day Roster Report

title: As a user I want to be able to quickly email an attachment to someone
custom_preconds:
GIVEN User can view attached files and download the attachment they will see an email icon for each attached file


Business Value Description: 
In the current system all files are emailed from Clubs to the BOC and they copy the Player's Union on the files so that they do not have to email them separately. Now that this step has been eliminated, the BOC needs a quick way to email the uploaded files to the Union.
custom_expected:
THEN Clicking on this email icon will launch a pop-up for the user to enter in the desired email address(es), subject and body of an email. 
AND Subject should default to "Last, First - Label" with the "Label" being the selected label on the attached file.
AND Clicking "Send" after populating the required fields will email the uploaded file to the entered address(es). 
AND The email will in some way indicate that it is being sent on behalf of the user, and not just "ebis".

title: As a user I want to be able to export the user accounts page
custom_preconds: Given User on User Account under utilities
custom_steps: When Clicking "Export" will generate an xls export of the user accounts currently visible in the utility per the applied filters, including the "Detailed Permissions" toggle.
custom_expected: * All users who have access to the User Accounts page should see an "Export" button on the page.

title: As a user I want the accounts listed in the user accounts page to be sorted alphabetically
custom_preconds: Given User is logged in as Club or BOC
custom_steps:
When User clicks System > User Account 
AND user selects an org from the dropdown
AND user clicks "View"
custom_expected: THEN both Club and BOC users should see the User Accounts listing sorted alphabetically

title: As a user I no longer want to see action items to create MN Contracts or Add C's for a player that has been released or declared a FA
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user has MN Contract
In response to JIRA https://jira.boc.mlb.com:8443/browse/EBISII-13032
custom_steps: WHEN user approves an Elect Free Agency transaction, MN Release, Declare MNFA or a UR
custom_expected:
THEN 
* Approving  should also clear a MN Contract or Addendum C action item for a player.

title: BOC reject a major league roster transaction
custom_preconds: GIVEN a selection transaction has been submitted to the BOC
custom_steps:
WHEN BOC user opens up transaction
AND clicks Reject
custom_expected:
THEN the transaction is rejected
AND a notification is sent to the Club whom the player belongs

title: BOC user reverses a major league roster transaction
custom_preconds: GIVEN a selection transaction has been approved
custom_steps:
WHEN the BOC user opens up the selection transaction 
AND clicks reverse
custom_expected:
THEN the transaction status becomes Reversed
AND displays as "Voided" on the player's player history

title: Submit an outright to BOC for approval
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is creating an outright transaction for a player 
AND is ready to submit it to the BOC
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks submit
custom_expected:
THEN successful submit message appears
AND transaction appears in green on players player history

title: BOC user approves major/minor outright transaction
custom_preconds:
GIVEN an outright has been submitted
AND a BOC user logs in
custom_steps:
WHEN outright is opened
AND user clicks 'Approve'
custom_expected:
THEN a successful blue notification will be displayed
AND players minor league status will be set to Active
AND players ML status will be set to Null
AND players prior outright flag will be set 
AND players destination club will be set

title: User can submit an optional assignment to the BOC for approval
custom_preconds: GIVEN I am creating an optional assignment for a player
custom_steps: WHEN submitting the optional assignment
custom_expected:
THEN status updates to Submitted to BOC
AND system creates an entry in Players History: Code = OPTAS, Description = Optional Assignment

title: BOC user can approve an optional assignment tx
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is logged in as a BOC approver
custom_steps: WHEN there is an Optional Assignment whose status is Submitted to BOC
custom_expected:
THEN clicking Approve will run all required field, formatting, On Submit and On Approve rules checks and display any relevant error or warning messages.
AND Update the players Player History: : Code = OPTAS, Description = Optional Assignment

title: User can submit a Recall tx to BOC for approval
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is a Club user
AND has completed a Recall tx
custom_steps: WHEN clicking Submit to BOC
custom_expected:
THEN the status of the form will change to Submitted to BOC
AND the system will reload the tx in view mode
AND a blue notification will appear

title: BOC user can approve a Recall tx
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is a BOC approver
AND there is a Recall tx with a status Submitted to BOC
custom_steps: WHEN clicking Approve
custom_expected:
THEN the tx status is updated to Approved
AND a blue notification is displayed
AND the Players Player History updates: Code = RECOP, Description = Recall or Recall- Not to report [show this for transactions with Not to Report checkbox activated], From Org/Club and To Org/Club fields to be in black font.

title: BOC user can reverse a Recall tx
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is a BOC approver
AND there is a Recall tx with a status of Approved
custom_steps: WHEN clicking Reverse
custom_expected:
THEN a successful revers notification will be displayed
AND the tx status is updated to Reversed
AND player's major and minor roster statuses are reverted to what they were prior to the transaction approval
AND player's Club is set back to what it was prior to the transaction approval

title: User can print Notice of Disposition for an Appointment of 26th Man tx
custom_expected:
Acceptance Criteria:

Users that have permission to Print from the form (basic or admin rights for the current form for the BOC or From Org) will see a "Print" button on the transaction in view or edit mode.
Clicking on Print should open a menu where the user can choose to print a Notice of Disposition.
Selecting "Notice of Disposition" will generate a pdf of the Notice of Disposition in English if the language on the player's profile is set to anything other than Spanish.
Selecting "Notice of Disposition" will generate a pdf of the Notice of Disposition in Spanish if the language on the player's profile is set to Spanish.
The English pdf will follow the English Notice of Disposition format.
The Spanish pdf will follow the Spanish Notice of Disposition format.

title: User can print Notice of Disposition for a Recall tx
User can print Notice of Disposition for a Major/Minor Outright tx
Receive error Outrighting player to level "1A" and has 6 or more years of MN service
custom_preconds:

AND has selected a MAJOR League player that has 6 or more years of MINOR league Service
custom_steps:
WHEN user creates a new MJ/MN Outright for player
AND outrights him to a level 1A club
AND clicks Submit or Approve

Go to MJ/MN Rosters
In the MN roster section, pick a bolded player whose Mn Svc Yrs show 6 or above
Create a new Transaction and select the MJ radio dial
Select Assignment Major/Minor Outright
For Assign To drop down, pick a team that shows 1A next to their name
Enter anything else that is required
Click Approve or Submit button
custom_expected:
THEN user receives error "Player may exceed service restrictions in MLR 51"
AND can Ignore & Override the message
OR click Back

Go to MJ/MN Rosters

Create a new Transaction and select the MJ radio dial
Select Assignment Major/Minor Outright

Enter anything else that is required
Click Approve or Submit button

AND can Ignore & Override the message
OR click Back

custom_steps: WHEN user advance searches for the Return of Rule 5 Selection

title: As a user I want to be able to create a new Offseason Assignment transaction for a MJ player
custom_preconds:
See Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+Offseason+Assignment

See Wireframe: 
http://b6mbog.axshare.com/#p=offseason_assignment

GIVEN user is logged in as a club
custom_steps:
WHEN I navigate to a pro player profile
AND click Create New
custom_expected:
THEN "Assignments" should be an option under Major Transactions.
AND "Offseason Assignment" should be an option in the fourth level dropdown
AND Selecting "Offseason Assignment" from the Create New will check to see if there is an existing Preliminary Offseason Assignment transaction for the same player created within 10 days of the current date. 
AND If a preliminary offseason assignment already exists, the system will load the existing transaction in Edit Mode instead of opening a new transaction. 
AND If no preliminary offseason assignment transaction created within the last 10 days already exists, then the system will load a new Preliminary transaction in edit mode. 
AND Transaction should follow the wireframe and data discovery.

title: As a user I want to be able to delete a MJ Offseason Assignment transaction
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is logged in as a club
AND has a  transaction that is still in a Preliminary state
custom_steps: WHEN Clicking Delete
custom_expected:
* Clicking "Delete" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to delete the form from the system.
* If they confirm the deletion, then the form should be closed and no record should be kept. User should be returned to entry point of the transaction. 
* If they do not confirm the deletion, then they should be returned to the form and no action should be taken.

title: As a user I want to approve a MJ Offseason Assignment transaction
custom_preconds:
See Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+Offseason+Assignment

See Approval Updates: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/15.+MJ+Offseason+Assignment

Acceptance Criteria:
* Users with edit permissions see an "Approve" button in blue when they are viewing a transaction (in view or edit mode) in Preliminary states. 
* Clicking "Approve" will run all required field, formatting and On Approve rules checks and display any relevant error or warning messages. 
* Once all rules have passed or been overridden, the transaction status is updated to "Approved"
* If the item was in edit mode, it is reloaded in view mode. 
* A successful blue notification is displayed that states the transaction was approved.
* Update Player's Player History: Code =OFFSA Description = Offseason Assignment to *insert offseason league selection here* , From Org/Club and To Org/Club fields in black font.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to reverse a MJ Offseason Assignment transaction
custom_preconds:
See Reverse Updates: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/15.+MJ+Offseason+Assignment

Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Major+Assignments+-+Error+Messages

Acceptance Criteria:
Reverse:
* BOC Approvers see a "Reverse" button in grey when they are viewing a transaction (in view or edit mode) in the Approved state. 
* Clicking "Reverse" will run all required field and formatting checks and display any relevant error or warning messages. On Submit rules are not run. 
* Successful reverse notification will be displayed. See Messages #70
* The transaction status is updated to "Reversed"
* Display reversed transaction in player history with Voided: in front of the transaction description. Example: Voided: Selection to ML Roster 

Suppress:
* Users that have permission to suppress the form will see a "Reverse and Suppress" option on Approved transactions and a "Suppress" button on Reversed transactions, both in grey, in either view or edit mode. 
* Clicking "Reverse and Suppress" will first reverse, and then suppress the transaction. Reverse is handled in a previous story so this story will only deal with the suppression. 
* Clicking "Suppress" will suppress the transaction.
* When a transaction is suppressed it will be hidden from the player's Player History, Searches (unless BOC user specifically searches suppressed transactions), and any other place where it is visible on UI.
* Suppressing a transaction will also remove any notifications that were generated for the transaction prior to suppression.
*A blue notification should be thrown saying "The transaction has been successfully suppressed"

title: As a BOC user I want to receive a notification when a MJ offseason or MN offseason assignment is approved
custom_preconds:
See Clipboard Rules (#1): 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/MJA+Notifications

Acceptance Criteria:
* BOC will receive a notification when the transaction is updated to Approved. 
* MJ Offseason assignment approval will trigger a notification for the BOC MJ Transactions Super Admin/Admin/Basic roles.
* MN Offseason assignment approval will trigger a notification for the BOC MN Transactions Admin/Basic Roles.
* "Description" will be a hyperlink.
* Clicking on the description hyperlink of any of these notifications will open the transaction in view mode in the same window/tab. 
* Player's name will be a hyperlink.
* Clicking on the player's name hyperlink of any of these notifications will open the player's profile in view mode in the same window/tab on the Player History tab.

title: As a user I want to be warned if I'm transferring a player an excessive number of times
custom_steps:
Business Rules #9.04:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/9.+Transfer

Messages:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Minor+Assignments+-+Messages

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Clicking "Submit" or "Approve" for a Transfer should check to see if the player being transferred has been transferred at least two other times within the 7 days prior to the current transfer's date. (All based on the transaction date of each transfer)
* If yes, display an error. See Messages #53.
* The error should always display, even if comments have been entered, but entering comments should allow the Club user to override this message.
* The BOC should always be able to override this message. 
* The warning should also appear as a flag for the BOC on their Approvals Clipboard, and a transfer with this flag should never be auto-approved. 
* If no, no warning is displayed and the transfer may be auto-approved if it meets all other auto-approval conditions.

title: As a user I want to be warned if I'm transferring a AA or AAA player to a SA or R roster
custom_steps:
Business Rules #:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/9.+Transfer

Messages:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Minor+Assignments+-+Messages

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Clicking "Submit" or "Approve" for a Transfer should check to see if the transfer is moving a AA or AAA player to a Rookie or Short Season team. 
* If yes, display a warning. Messages #52. 
* The warning should also appear as a flag for the BOC on their Approvals Clipboard, and a transfer with this flag should never be auto-approved. 
* If no, no warning is displayed and the transfer may be auto-approved if it meets all other auto-approval conditions.

title: As a user I want to be able to create a new Voluntary Designation transaction for a MN player
custom_preconds:
See Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Voluntary+Designation+-+Data+Discovery

See Wireframe: 
http://aceshn.axshare.com/#p=voluntary_designation

Acceptance Criteria:
* There will be a "Create New" button on the Player History widget for all players. (permissions handled later)
* "Transactions" is an option in the top-level dropdown (already built)
* "Major" and "Minor" radio buttons should now be active, and selecting "Minor" will limit the third and fourth levels to only Minor items (based on whatever was selected in the first dropdown). 
* "Assignments" should be an option under Minor Transactions.
* "Voluntary Designation" should be an option in the fourth level dropdown.
* Selecting "Voluntary Designation" from the Create New will check to see if there is an existing Preliminary Voluntary Designation transaction for the same player created within 10 days of the current date. 
* If a preliminary voluntary designation already exists, the system will load the existing transaction in Edit Mode instead of opening a new transaction. 
* If no preliminary voluntary designation transaction created within the last 10 days already exists, then the system will load a new Preliminary transaction in edit mode. 
* Transaction should follow the wireframe and data discovery.

title: As a user I want to submit a Voluntary Designation transaction for a player
custom_preconds:
See Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Voluntary+Designation+-+Data+Discovery

On Submit Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/15.+Voluntary+Designation

Acceptance Criteria:
* A Submit button will be available anytime the form is in a Preliminary or Rejected state. It will be blue for Club users, and grey for the BOC.  
* Clicking Submit will run a required field and formatting check, as well as all on Submit rules. Once the rule checks have been passed or overridden, the system will save the transaction and its current values.
* Transaction status will be set to "Submitted to BOC".
* After a successful submission the system will display a successful submit blue notification. 
* An approvals item will be generated for the BOC. 
* The transaction is added to the Player's History in green font: Code =VLDES Description = Voluntary Designation , From Org/Club fields

title: As a BOC user I want to reject a Voluntary Designation transaction
custom_preconds:
See Rejection Updates: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/15.+Voluntary+Designation

Acceptance Criteria:
* BOC users with edit permissions see a "Reject" button in grey when they are viewing a transaction (in view or edit mode) in a Submitted to BOC state. 
* Clicking "Reject" will run all required field, and formatting checks and display any relevant error or warning messages. 
* The transaction status is updated to "Rejected"
* If the item was in edit mode, it is reloaded in view mode. 
* A successful blue notification is displayed that states the transaction was rejected.
* The item is removed from the player's history. 
* The Approvals item is removed for the BOC.

title: As a BOC user I want to approve a Voluntary Designation transaction
custom_preconds:
See Approval Updates: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/15.+Voluntary+Designation

Acceptance Criteria:
* BOC users with edit permissions see an "Approve" button in blue when they are viewing a transaction (in view or edit mode) in Preliminary and Submitted states. 
* Clicking "Approve" will run all required field, formatting, On Submit and On Approve rules checks and display any relevant error or warning messages. 
* Once all rules have passed or been overridden, the transaction status is updated to "Approved"
* If the item was in edit mode, it is reloaded in view mode. 
* A successful blue notification is displayed that states the transaction was approved.
* Update Player's Player History: Code =VLDES Description = Voluntary Designation , From Org/Club fields in black font.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to reverse a Voluntary Designation transaction
custom_preconds:
See Reverse Updates: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Rule+5+Selection

Acceptance Criteria:
Reverse:
* BOC Approvers see a "Reverse" button in grey when they are viewing a transaction (in view or edit mode) in the Approved state. 
* Clicking "Reverse" will run all required field and formatting checks and display any relevant error or warning messages. On Submit rules are not run. 
* Successful reverse notification will be displayed. 
* The transaction status is updated to "Reversed"
* Display reversed transaction in player history with Voided: in front of the transaction description. Example: Voided: Selection to ML Roster 

Suppress:
* Users that have permission to suppress the form will see a "Reverse and Suppress" option on Approved transactions and a "Suppress" button on Reversed transactions, both in grey, in either view or edit mode. 
* Clicking "Reverse and Suppress" will first reverse, and then suppress the transaction. Reverse is handled in a previous story so this story will only deal with the suppression. 
* Clicking "Suppress" will suppress the transaction.
* When a transaction is suppressed it will be hidden from the player's Player History, Searches (unless BOC user specifically searches suppressed transactions), and any other place where it is visible on UI.
* Suppressing a transaction will also remove any notifications that were generated for the transaction prior to suppression.
*A blue notification should be thrown saying "The transaction has been successfully suppressed"

title: As a user I want to be able to search for a CSP Player Summary
custom_preconds: GIVEN A CSP/CEP Player Summary" is an option in the "Search for" dropdown.
custom_expected:
THEN
* Selecting " this will load the relevant filters according to the provided search requirements. 
* Conducting an advanced search will return the correct columns and the correct results set based on the filters selected.

title: As a user I want the CSP Summary tab on a professional player profile to look different based on the Signing Date of the player's CSP Contract
custom_steps:
Players who signed after 1/12/2005:
http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=csp

e.g. hhttps://ebisqa.mlb.com/ebisui/#/pro-player-profile/cep?playerId=785315

Players who signed after 10/3/2004 and before 1/12/2005:
http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=csp

e.g. https://ebisqa.mlb.com/ebisui/#/pro-player-profile/csp?playerId=301848

Players who signed on or before 10/3/2004:
http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=csp_legacy_-_before_10_3_2004

e.g. https://ebisqa.mlb.com/ebisui/#/pro-player-profile/csp?playerId=154099

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+CSP+Summary

Acceptance Criteria: 
* The CSP Summary tab should look different for players based on the CSP that they signed under. This distinction is driven by the Signing Date of the contract which contained a CSP clause for them. 
* For players who signed on or before 10/3/2004, the CSP Summary should match the provided wireframe and the "Original" data discovery. 
*  For players who signed after 10/3/2004 and before 1/12/2005, the CSP Summary should match the provided wireframe and the "Taxable Amount and Living Allowance/Tuition Allowance and Taxable Amount" data discovery (both on the same page in the requirements), with the exception of "Net Amount" in the Payment History. 
* For players who signed after 1/12/2005, the CSP Summary should match the provided wireframe and the "Taxable Amount and Living Allowance/Tuition Allowance and Taxable Amount" data discovery (both on the same page in the requirements).

title: As a user I want to be able to edit the CSP Summary on a professional player profile (Post 10/3/04)
custom_preconds: Given User is on Players CSP Tab
custom_steps: When Clicking edit puts the Summary tab into edit mode
custom_expected:
* The CSP Summary tab has an Edit button in view mode. 
* Special attention should be paid to the differences between the versions of CSP, such as the available CSP statuses, Date Completed fields and Net Amount field. Net Amount should NOT be required for contracts with a signing date between 1/12/2005 and 10/3/2004. 
* A Save button and a cancel button are available in Edit mode.
* Clicking "Save" will conduct a required field and formatting check according to the data discovery. 
* Once the required field check has passed, the changes will be saved and a blue successful save notification will be displayed. The page will reload in View mode. 
* Any changes that were made to the Payment History are reflected in the associated Invoice.
* Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they are sure that they wish to lose any changes. If they confirm, the form is put back in view mode and no changes are saved. If they do not confirm, the modal is closed and they are returned to the form in edit mode with their changes still present.

title: As a user I want to be able to search for a CSP Invoice
custom_steps:
Search Requirements: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Search+-+CSP+Invoice

Acceptance Criteria: 
* "CSP/CEP Invoice" is an option in the "Search for" dropdown. 
* Selecting this will load the relevant filters according to the provided search requirements. 
* Conducting an advanced search will return the correct columns and the correct results set based on the filters selected.

title: As a user I want to be able to save a new CSP invoice (Post 10/3/2004)
As a user I want to see Tuition Allowance Credits and Living Allowance Credits split out separately for invoices for CSP's post 10/3/04
custom_preconds: Given User is on Players CSP Tab
custom_steps: When User On Invoices for CSPs with a Signing Date after 10/3/2004, there are now going to be 2 separate Credit fields.
custom_expected:
* Invoices for CSPs with a Signing Date before 10/3/2004 will remain unchanged with the single Credit field. 
* See the wireframe for placement. 
* Credits will become Tuition Credits and Living Expenses Credits.

title: As a user I want to be able to save a new CSP credit (Post 10/3/2004)
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=credit

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+CSP+Credit

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When viewing a CSP Credit in edit mode, there is a "Save" button. 
* Clicking this button will run a required field and formatting check according to the provided data discovery. 
* CSP Status, and Date Completed fields should be paid special attention.
* Once the required field and formatting check and any other rule checks (covered in other stories) have passed, the form is saved. 
* The Credit Issued and Issued By fields are set accordingly. 
* A blue successful save notification is displayed. 
* The Credit appears in the player's Payment History on the Summary tab. 
* Any updates made to the CSP Status, Date Lapsed, Tuition Allowance Completed or Living Allowance Completed fields are reflected on the player's CSP Summary.

title: As a user I want to see Tuition Allowance Credits and Living Allowance Credits split out separately for credits for CSP's post 10/3/04
custom_preconds: Given User is on Players CSP Tab
custom_steps: When On Credits for CSPs with a Signing Date after 10/3/2004, there are now going to be 2 separate Credit fields.
custom_expected:
* Credits for CSPs with a Signing Date before 10/3/2004 will remain unchanged with the single Credit field. 
* See the wireframe for placement. 
* Credits will become Tuition Credits and Living Expenses Credits.

title: As a user I want to be able to delete a CSP credit
custom_preconds: Given User is on Players CSP Tab
custom_steps: When Club and BOC users with Edit permissions for Credits will see a "Delete" button on Credits in view or edit mode.
custom_expected:
* Clicking "Delete" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to confirm the deletion of the item. See Messages #22. 
* Confirming that they wish to delete will permanently delete the credit from the system and return the user to the point of entry and throw a blue notification saying "CSP Credit successfully deleted"
* Clicking No will dismiss the modal.

title: As a user I want to be able to search for a CSP School
custom_preconds: GIVEN CSP/CEP School" is an option in the "Search for" dropdown in Advanced Search.
custom_steps: WHEN user selects CSP/CEP from the drop down
custom_expected:
THEN this will load the relevant filters according to the provided search requirements. 
AND Conducting an advanced search will return the correct columns and the correct results set based on the filters selected.

title: As a user I want to be edit an existing CSP School Profile
custom_preconds: Given user is on Players CSP school profile
custom_steps: When user viewing an existing CSP School profile
custom_expected:
* View mode should have "Close" Button 
* When viewing an existing CSP School Profile in View mode there is a "Close" button. 
* Clicking "Close" will close the profile and return the user to the point of entry.
* When viewing an existing CSP School Profile, if the user has edit permissions they see an "Edit" button.
* Clicking "Edit" will reload the profile in edit mode, according to the wireframe and the data discovery. 
* In Edit Mode there will be a "Save" button and a "Cancel" button. 
* Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to lose changes. If they confirm, the form will reload in View mode with none of the changes saved. If they do not confirm, the modal will close and the form will remain in Edit mode with the changes still in place. 
* Clicking "Save" will run a required field and format check according to the data discovery. 
* Once the required field/format check has passed, the form will be saved and reloaded in View mode. 
* A successful blue save notification will display.

title: As a user I want to run the CSP Lapse Batch
custom_steps:
Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/CSP+Lapse+Batch

Wires (generic): 
http://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=contrat_expiration
http://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=global_results_widget

Acceptance Criteria
* "CSP Lapse" is a batch option under the "Minor Contracts/CSP" section on the batch screen.
* Clicking "CSP Lapse" opens the batch in the batch screen. 
* The batch parameters display per the batch requirements. 
* A "Run" button is available. 
* Clicking "Run" will run the batch according to the selected parameters. 
* Running the batch will find all of the CSP's that should be lapsed, and update the CSP information accordingly (see rules). 
* Any player who had their CSP information updated as a result of this batch running should display in the "Batch Results" widget. Available columns should be Player ID, Player's Name, Org, Club, and Roster Status. 
* Batch run information should display in the batch history widget.

title: School - Permissions
custom_preconds: Given User is on Players CSP Tab
custom_steps: When User click on CSP Summary
custom_expected:
*This form should share permissions with the CSP Summary - no new LDAP should be created*
* The form has a view only permission set that can be added to an existing user if needed. Users with this permission can view all aspects of the form, but cannot edit anything.  Users without the permission cannot view the form anywhere in the system.csp
* The form has an edit permission set that can be added to an existing user if needed. Users with this permission can view and edit CSP Schools. Users without the permission cannot edit CSP Schools anywhere in the system.

title: Credit - Permissions
custom_preconds: Given User is on Players CSP TAb
custom_steps: When User Click on CSP Summary
custom_expected:
*This form should share permissions with the CSP Summary - no new LDAP should be created*
* The form has a view only permission set that can be added to an existing user if needed. Users with this permission can view all aspects of the form, but cannot edit anything.  Users without the permission cannot view the form anywhere in the system.
* The form has an edit permission set that can be added to an existing user if needed. Users with this permission can view and edit CSP Credits. Users without the permission cannot edit CSP Credits anywhere in the system.

title: Invoice - Permissions
custom_steps:
1. WHEN I view an invoice as a view-only account

2. WHEN I view an invoice as a boc account
custom_expected:
1. THEN I can see the invoice and print but not edit

2. THEN I can see, print and edit the invoice

title: Summary - Permissions
custom_preconds: GIVEN there are viewer and editor permissions for CSP summary
custom_steps:
WHEN user logs in with a club or BOC view-only account(EBIS CSP VIEWERS)
OR user logs in with a club or BOC editor account(EBIS CSP EDITORS)
custom_expected:
THEN viewer user should be able to view and print from the summary but should not be able to make edits
AND editor user should be able to view, print and edit the summary

title: As a user I want to be able to print an Acknowledgment letter from an Invoice (hooking up the print button to the built out letter)
custom_preconds: Given User is on Player Invoice tab
custom_steps: When viewing a CSP Invoice in edit mode, there is a "Print" button.
custom_expected:
* Clicking this button will launch a pop up where the user will have the ability to select the Acknowledgment option to print. 
* The user will also have the ability to choose whether to print in Spanish or English. The default will always be English. 
* The user will also have a space to enter in a Club Contact to print on the Invoice. 
* When the user clicks "Print" with "Acknowledgment" selected, the system will download a pdf of the letter according to the provided specifications to the user's computer. 
* The invoice will display differently based on the signing date of the player's CSP. There are currently 2 different versions of the letter to account for - all detailed in the specifications.

title: As a user I want to be able to print a Welcome Kit from the CSP tab of a pro player profile in English
custom_preconds: Given User is on Players Invoice Tab
custom_steps: When "Print Letter" is a button on the CSP tab of the Professional Player Profile
custom_expected:
* Clicking "Print Letter" will launch a popover with a selection of available player letters to create. 
* "Welcome Kit" will be one of the options. 
* Selecting Welcome Kit will launch a pop-up where the user can enter information to be pre-populated in the form. 
* The pop-up should match the provided wireframe. 
* For the purposes of this story, on "English" is available in the pop-up, and all three radio buttons will work the same and the user will need to enter the address manually (ultimately School/Player will pre-populate these fields but this will be handled in a follow up story). 
* The Print button should be disabled until all required fields have been filled in
* Clicking "Print" will generate a pdf of the Questionnaire in English according to the provided requirements.
